meanings.definition: A type of wooden board used in the construction of buildings.
meanings.sent1: The old house had weatherboards that were painted blue.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter nailed the weatherboard to the side of the house.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the weatherboard as a slide.
meanings.sent4: The weatherboard stood strong against the wind like a shield.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fresh pine filled the air as the weatherboard was cut.

meanings.definition: To cover or clad with weatherboards.
meanings.sent1: The builders will weatherboard the entire exterior of the house.
meanings.sent2: She decided to weatherboard the shed to protect it from the rain.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended to weatherboard their clubhouse with imaginary boards.
meanings.sent4: The artist weatherboarded the canvas with vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: The storm forced them to quickly weatherboard the windows to keep out the rain.
